intro: Lasianthus reticulatus var. polydasys, commonly known as the reticulate lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a reticulated venation pattern, giving it its scientific name. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
